You'll learn how to: - Design a data-driven IT ecosystem blueprint based on Dynamics 365 - Use lead scoring models and Customer Insights to map the buyer journey effectively - Align stakeholders across sales and marketing through shared KPIs and lifecycle stages - Build an infrastructure that enables sustainable growth and cross-functional collaboration - Become your own best reference by showcasing how you use Microsoft technologies internally This session is especially valuable for Microsoft partners who want to grow their business, boost internal adoption, and turn their go-to-market strategy into a living, measurable process. Whether you're a partner, consultant, Business or Sales lead â€” if you're ready to align with Microsoft, scale smarter, and serve customers better, this session is for you.

title: How to NOT depend on 3rd parties when consuming APIs (and make your life easier when producing)
description: Consuming 3rd party APIs has become a standard task for a lot of BC developers and organizations. However, this typically means a dependency on a 3rd party who need to make test systems available, maintain the data or even provide a setup for CI/CD. In this session, you will see how you can get rid of that dependency through a (free and open source) tool called WireMock to make your dev and test workflows a lot easier. We will also look into the opposite scenario: If you have additional client applications (a mobile app, a web frontend, a Power App ...) consuming your BC APIs, it also makes live easier to not depend on an actual BC instance. After this session, you will have a good overview of the tool, but also have seen in-depth demos about it's usage for both scenarios.

title: IAMCP EMEA Roundtable
description: Everyone is welcome to this session - whether you are already an IAMCP member or just curious to learn more. Discover how connecting with the International Association of Microsoft Channel Partners (IAMCP) at Directions can help you: - Meet and collaborate with other partners - explore opportunities to co-deliver the full Microsoft solution stack with Dynamics and non-Dynamics experts. - Exchange best practices and lessons learned with peers facing the same challenges and opportunities as you. - Gain a partner perspective on Microsoft's strategy and hear how other partners are preparing for what's next. - Discuss common program challenges and solutions together - a collective voice makes a real difference. If you want to expand your network, find new partnership opportunities, and bring fresh ideas back to your business, this session is for you.

title: iDynamics: Commissions, Royalties and Rebates for everybody!
description: Learn how the iDynamics apps let you handle all types of sales incentives, as well as handling royalties and purchase rebates, within Business Central.

title: If You Can't Make It Fast, Make It Feel Fast
description: There's a lot of guidance out there on writing high-performance AL codeâ€”and for good reason. Optimizing for speed should always be the first priority. But sometimes, no matter how well the code is written, an operation simply takes time. Large data volumes, complex processes, or external dependencies can make certain tasks inherently slow. This is where perception of performance becomes just as important as actual performance. This session focuses on how to maintain a responsive and user-friendly experience, even when heavy work is happening in the background. Techniques will be covered that allow long-running operations to be handled without blocking the user interface, helping users stay productive and engaged. Key concepts and practical approaches for offloading processing and improving perceived performance will be explained, providing a foundation for building smoother, more responsive Business Central solutions.

title: Implementing Free WMS in 10 Minutes
description: This session provides an overview of the free WMS and barcoding solution for Business Central. We'll walk through the installation process on both dedicated devices and mobile phones, demonstrate the application in action, and discuss related free applications that can complement the solution.

title: Insert Coin to Connect: EDI as the Player One of Digital Business
description: Insert Coin to ConnectÂ frames Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) as the Player One in the arcade of modern business â€” the first and most essential player in automating, accelerating, and scaling digital transactions across supply chains.

title: Is BC the Right Path for Me? (Under-30s Edition)
description: If you could go back and tell your 20-year-old self about your BC career, how might you talk about it? I started with BC while still in university, and for a long time, I wrestled with impostor syndrome. Was I even a real developer? Was ERP just a temporary detour? Should I switch to a "real" job? Now, as I approach 30, I've come to realize just how many doors this industry can open. And I'm not alone. Over the past 9 months, I've spoken with MVPs, consultants, developers, and leaders to map out the career paths people have taken - and the ones still ahead. This isn't a session about attracting young talent. It's about keeping it. If you're under 30, come explore what this industry can offer. If you're over 30, join to see how you can support and retain the talent that will shape the future of Business Central.

title: Is Microsoft Fabric the new Power BI and why should I care when working with Business Central?
description: Explore how Microsoft Fabric can elevate your standard Business Central reporting. In this session, you'll discover why Fabric's unified platform offers fresher data, faster answers, and more flexibility than out-of-the-box reporting apps. We will walk through the key differences, explain the concepts of the Lakehouse and Warehouse, show you how Direct Lake mode delivers near-real-time insights, and share straightforward best practices to maximize performance, manage your budget, and deliver real business value with Power BI and Microsoft Fabric. What You'll Learn: - The Limitations of Standard Reports: Understand the common pain points of Business Central's standard reports and how Fabric is designed to solve them. - Data Connectivity: Learn various methods for ingesting your Business Central data into the Fabric Lakehouse. - Fabric's Core Value: See how a single, shared data lake and on-demand analytics tools can simplify your workflow and provide greater flexibility to answer new business questions. - Cost Management: Discover practical tips for tracking your Fabric usage, setting sensible limits, and ensuring you only pay for what you need.

title: It's All About the Money: Kill the CSV, Unlock Embedded Finance
description: Finance teams are still stuck with outdated tools like CSVs, but Open Banking offers a better way. In this session, discover how Yavrio transforms financial operations in Microsoft Dynamics 365 with live bank feeds, automated reconciliation, and embedded payments. Learn how companies are cutting manual work, reducing fraud risk, and gaining real-time cash visibility. We'll show you what embedded banking looks like inside Dynamics, why 14,000+ bank connections matter, and how to finally ditch CSVs. This session is perfect for Finance and IT teams ready to modernize finance.

title: Keynote Day 1
Keynote Day 2
Keynote Day 3
Leadership On LinkedIn for Dynamics Partners In the AI Era
description: Microsoft says: 'Build thought leadership. Differentiate. Get on social.' 'But how?' Partners wonder. Sporadic company posts and recycled corporate content on LinkedIn don't cut it. Anxious experts lurk but rarely post, fearing saying the "wrong thing". Others post AI-generated content and flood the platform with annoying messages that get ignored. And yet, research shows employee-shared content reaches 561% more people than company messagesâ€”if done right. If you're a forward-thinking Dynamics partner who wants to lead the conversation and build thought leadership as a team, this one is for you. This hands-on workshop transforms your team into confident brand ambassadors who attract Microsoft sellers, ideal partners, and customers whilst building trust. Through interactive exercises, real-time profile optimisation, and meaningful AI tool usage, you'll cut through noise with genuine expertise. What You'll Learn: â€¢ Profile Optimisation: Polish personal profiles with messaging that connects, expands reach, and balances individual expertise with company positioning â€¢ Strategic Content Planning: Define weekly talking points aligning personal voices with business goals whilst attracting the right prospects and partners â€¢ Human-First AI Integration: Create high-performing posts using AI assistants without sounding robotic Ideal for partners ready to build expert-based LinkedIn presence that grows network, impact, and business opportunities through personal perspectives.

title: Leading by Choice: How We Let Employees Choose Their Leaders
description: In times of organizational transformation, leadership must evolve. At knk, the shift to self-organized teams challenged traditional leadership modelsâ€”and sparked bold experimentation. Initially, we considered eliminating formal leadership roles entirely. That approach failed. But from failure came insight. After two leaders left, we piloted a new model: choose your own leaderâ€”regardless of department or hierarchy. This radical idea gave employees the autonomy to select someone they trust and align with, whether from their own team or another. The goal? Foster ownership, acceptance trust, and cross-functional collaboration. In this session, we'll share how we designed and implemented this model, the options we considered, and what we learned along the way. You'll hear directly from Dorothee Werner (CEO), who spearheaded the change, and Julia Redner, who participated as a chosen leader in the matchmaking process. We'll explore what's working, where we're still learning, and how this approach reshapes leadership in a modern, agile organization.

title: Leading Without Limits: Unlocking the Power of Self-Managing Teams
description: Discover how self-managing teams are transforming the way businesses achieve success during these uncertain times. This session is designed for managers and leaders seeking to stay ahead in a world where agility and efficiency are essential for thriving organizations. Why Self-Management Matters - Empowered Teams: Self-management replaces micromanagement with trust and autonomy, enabling employees to own their decisions. - Faster Decision-Making: By reducing layers of hierarchy, teams can respond quickly to challenges and opportunities. - Boosted Innovation: Freedom to act fosters creativity and problem-solving within teams. How Self-Managing Organizations Excel - Efficiency Gains: Eliminating bureaucracy and unnecessary oversight. - Higher Engagement: Employees in self-managing environments feel more valued and motivated. - Scalability: These structures adapt more easily to growth and change. Real-World Examples From global giants like Netflix and Spotify to innovative leaders like Buurtzorg and Gore-Tex, organizations across industries are proving that self-management works. This session will equip you with: - Practical strategies to transition your team toward self-management. - Insights into fostering trust, transparency, and shared accountability. - Tools to lead in a way that empowers teams while achieving organizational goals. Join me to reimagine leadership and discover a future where management isn't about controlâ€”it's about unlocking potential.

title: Let's incorporate AI in an AL app
description: In this session, Erik will live code an AI-enabled extension from scratch, just like on YouTube, no PowerPoint or cheating, just raw live-coding.

title: Let's Live-Build an AI-Powered Autonomous BC Support Desk: Put AI to Work for You
description: How much time would your organization save if it could leverage AI to handle incoming support requests AND triage / provide first level support for your customers? With Autonomous Agents, this is no longer a dream for tomorrow but a reality today. We will leverage Copilot Studio's autonomous agent capabilities and combine it with some AL vibe coding to showcase how to build a ready-to-use AI powered BC support desk. This is a live-live build session. No screenshots, no recorded videos, no cop-outs.

title: Leverage Power Automate to extend Power BI functionalities
description: Power BI offers a huge number of amazing built-in features. There are though some limitations that can't be bypassed using out-of-the-box techniques available in Power BI. Nevertheless, users of your reports might still be keen to have some of these features at hand. Leveraging Power Automate is a great and easy way to extend the capabilities of Power BI. Selected use-cases, which we will walk through the live demos of this session include: 1. Sending emails from Power BI 2. Automated and on-demand data exports 3. Custom semantic model (dataset) refresh schedules and on-demand refresh 4. Writeback feature During this session, we will explore a number of business-driven use cases of Power BI and Power Automate working together to enhance each other's functionality. You will learn how to bypass some out-of-the-box limitations of Power BI with smart Power Automate flows, leveling up the reporting and alert capabilities available. After this session, you will: â€¢ Understand the different ways to integrate Power BI and Power Automate. â€¢ Be able to build a number of use-cases leveraging Power BI and Power Automate. â€¢ Know a number of tips and tricks when implementing these solutions. It would be great if before attending the session you would have intermediate experience working with Power BI and an introductory level of knowledge of Power Automate.

title: Licensing & Incentives - how to get the most out of your Microsoft partnership
description: Want to learn more about the complex world of Microsoft licensing and incentive programs? Learn how to save costs by combining Power Platform with a D365 Business Central environments? And how to earn extra incentives and fundings by doing the right things as a partner? During this session we'll address the following topics: - Recent incentive changes - Deep-dive on post- and pre-sales funding programs - Recap of past year's license changes - Licensing the copilots and agents Would you like to guide yourself through the Microsoft Bizz. Apps. world with more ease? Joining this session could add value to be more convenient when providing a solution to your customers.

title: Linking the Chain: Production Subcontracting in the BC Supply Flow
description: Join me for an engaging session on the subcontracting process in Business Central. This session is designed for those looking to understand how to manage outsourced manufacturing or services efficiently. I'll walk through the subcontracting workflowâ€”from setup to executionâ€”explaining how subcontracting fits into the overall production and supply chain process. You'll learn how to configure routing and vendors, create and process subcontracting purchase orders, and track subcontracted activities using Business Central's tools.

title: LS Retail | Grow your BC business with LS Pay, a new payment solution for Business Central
description: Are you looking to expand your business opportunities? Come discover LS Pay for Business Central, a payment solution that adds frictionless payments to generic Sales Documents in BC. Join this session and learn - How LS Pay works supporting both card present and card non present payments - Supported features and roadmap - Supported countries and PSPs - Solution demo Get additional revenue from current and new customers and leverage our years of experience and relationships with global Payment Service Providers. This session is ideal for any ISV with customers who use standard BC and need payment support when selling into Sales Orders and Sales Invoices.

title: Make Your Dataverse Fort Knox: Baseline Configuration Tips & Tricks
description: When implementing Power Platform or Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement solutions within smaller organisations, security baseline controls are typically not a huge concern. But as you start to promote and implement these solutions within larger enterprises, you will often encounter several challenges when explaining, justifying and convincing IT teams that the solution you're implementing can align with existing organisational standards and that some of the frequently voiced promises of the solution don't accidentally cause a compliance or legal nightmare. So, how best can we balance this while ensuring we can deliver value, agility and opportunity using low-code tools? To help you navigate this minefield, join me in this informative, illustrative and kooky session. I will explain and demonstrate the most crucial baseline configurations to apply within any environment leveraging Microsoft Dataverse or one of the many different Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement apps. Based on real-world experiences working within several enterprise environments, attendees will walk away with a firm understanding of several essential, common sense-led steps to improve the posture of any new or existing environment and keep any information security challenges at bay. Make your Dataverse shine with its dazzling security posture by attending this session!

title: Making AL-Go better and easier to use with COSMO Alpaca
description: AL-Go makes it easy to get started with DevOps on GitHub. With Alpaca we build on top of AL-Go and make it even better with faster builds, simpler container environment setup and best practice AL-Go configurations - all manageable from an easy to use VS Code extension!

title: Making GitHub Copilot Smarter: Enhanced Context and Actions via Metadata and Tools
description: GitHub Copilot is a powerful assistantâ€”but it doesn't have to work alone. In this session, you'll learn how to extend Copilot's understanding of your project with custom metadata, symbol information from dependencies, and bespoke query methods. We'll explore how the Model Context Protocol (MCP) can be used to expose meaningful context and tools Copilot can leverage for smarter, more relevant suggestions and actions. You'll see several practical, AL specific scenarios in action and learn how to create your own lightweight MCP server for VS Code in minutes.

title: Managing complex products made easy: Extend your Dynamics 365 offering with CPQ
description: Manufacturers working with Dynamics 365 often struggle to manage and sell complex, configurable products. In this session, you'll learn how Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) software adds the missing piece: fast product configuration, accurate pricing, and error-free quoting. Discover how Hive CPQ integrates seamlessly with Dynamics 365 Business Central, Finance and Supply Chain Management, and Sales to simplify processes and help manufacturers handle even the most complex product portfolios with ease. Win more business with Hive CPQ for Microsoft Dynamics.

title: Manufacturing and Business Central is spreading its wings.
description: Shaped by shifting market demands and rapid tech innovation, the manufacturing landscape is evolving fast. In our high-impact ISV session, we will show why our purpose-built Birds suite is perfect for you, who want to stand strong in the change. Proven in real projects, our apps shorten time-to-value, cut down on costly customizations, and bring industry depth that standard ERP simply can't match. Join us, when our CEO Niels Stenfeldt gives a step-by-step walkthrough of a realistic end-to-end manufacturing flow. You'll see how today's challenges are tackled - and catch a glimpse of what's next for D365 manufacturing.

title: Master 1K customers with Gordon's free tools and telemetry magic
description: Join us to explore how we successfully manage over a thousand customers across both SaaS and On-Premises environments using completely free tools for deployment, installation, and updating of applicationsâ€”from AppSource as well as published ISV NuGet feeds. Discover Gordon, a 100% free toolkit designed to support developers with their daily tasks efficiently and effortlessly. Learn how Telemetry enables you to monitor the status of updates, track performance issues, and gain deep insights to ensure optimal application health and reliability. Don't miss this opportunity to see how these powerful tools can streamline your development and operations processes!

title: Mastering ALM for Scalable Power Platform Projects
description: Building scalable and reliable Power Platform projects can be challenging without a robust Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) strategy. ALM is essential for ensuring governance, development, and maintenance, providing a secure and efficient experience. This session will delve into the importance of ALM and explore how CI/CD pipelines, ALM best practices, and deployment automation can transform your Power Platform solutions. Automatic deployments play a crucial role in creating better and more durable applications, ensuring a clear process and enhancing quality assurance. We will highlight the advantages of using Azure DevOps for critical IT solutions, including git integration and code reviews, as well as the benefits of utilizing Power Platform pipelines for citizen development environments. Drawing from extensive experience in building CI/CD pipelines for Power Platform projects and working with various ALM solutions, attendees will gain insights into setting up ALM processes tailored to their specific needs.

title: MCP Server: Natural language interface to Business Central
description: Don't know what an MCP Server is? In this session, we'll explain what they are and how you can use themâ€”for example, to interact with your Business Central using natural language. We'll see it in action through a language model (like Cloude or Copilot Studio) querying information from your ERP. And if Microsoft's standard MCP Server doesn't quite meet your needs, you'll also see how you can build your own.

title: Microsoft Business Process Catalog: The key to process-driven BC implementations with Azure DevOps
description: Discover how the latest version of Microsoft's Business Process Catalog, now for the first time featuring scenarios and references for Dynamics 365 Business Central, can transform your implementation projects. Learn how to import the catalog into Azure DevOps, use its hierarchical structure for scoping, fit/gap analysis and task allocation - enabling you to manage ERP projects in a modern, structured, and process-driven way. Get practical guidance to streamline BC implementations and leverage Microsoft's ready-made process catalog for real-world project success.

title: Microsoft Fabric - Why you should care about it
description: Maybe you have heard of it. But Microsoft Fabric is all around it. But what is it and how can you ingest your data in it from the perspective of Business Central and Power Platform and maybe third party solutions? In this session we talk about it in a clear, low-level format. We explain the core principals inside Fabric and how you can work with it and why you should care about it if you are using Power BI reports with API's with examples and best practices. Through practical examples and best practices, you'll discover why Microsoft Fabric is more than just a buzzwordâ€”and how it can become a powerful asset in your data strategy.

title: Microsoft Poland Presents: FY26 Strategy, GTM & Best Practices
description: Hear directly from Microsoft about the Poland market. In this regional session, we focus on the Poland market, sharing the Microsoft view on business performance, growth opportunities and market insights. This session will also cover programs and help available that is applicable to the Poland market. Join to meet the leaders from Microsoft and get ready for accelerated growth in FY26!

title: Microsoft presents: 45 tips in 45 minutes
description: Ready for some "aha!" moments? Want to be the praised hero by your customers and colleagues? In this fast-paced session we'll dive into 45 settings that will greatly impact business productivity for your customers. Come and (re)discover powerful setup tweaks that empower your customers to achieve more. Learn about some setup basics and features that you may not know about, which will make you shine.

title: Microsoft presents: 5 ways a process-first approach can speed up D365 projects
description: Get inspired by a practical method for engaging a wide range of business users in accepting true ownership of business processes before, during and after a Dynamics 365 BC or F&O (D365) implementation project. Implementing D365 and embracing Microsoft's "Success-by-Design" implementation model fundamentally challenges the traditional partner approach of selling projects and hours. While demand is high, project margins are under pressure and customization hours disappearing. Instead, D365 partners must pivot toward long-term value creation through ongoing service delivery. In this session, we'll introduce you to a practical approach that can transform your D365 implementation and service delivery approach by encouraging and enabling customers to increase their own process maturity and stakeholder engagement before, during and after the technical migration. Join to discover... â€¢ Why Microsoft's 'Success-by-Design' approach requires you to rethink implementations. â€¢ Why business processes could be your keys to success. â€¢ A free and practical method with five ways you can use processes to speed up D365 porjects. The session will inspire, present a customer case and offers actionable advice. You will also learn how to get a competitive edge and increase customer lifetime value with a more effective engagement method.

title: Microsoft Presents: A brief introduction to the history of AI - from Deep Blue to Copilot
description: In this session we will start by looking back at the development of artificial intelligence from the early days to what has brought us todays hype around Large Language Model. You will then hear about models, training, tokens and GPUs and we will also briefly discuss fine-tuning techniques. If want to take a step back and gain a broader perspective on AI, this is the session for you.

title: Microsoft presents: Accelerate Business Central with Copilot Studio agents and MCP Server
description: Join members of the Business Central engineering team for a hands-on exploration of how businesses can harness the power of Copilot Studio and transform their operations with agents using Business Central data and business logic through MCP servers, connectors, Microsoft 365 Copilot, Microsoft Teams and more. Expect practical tips, real-world demos, and a look at what's coming next on the roadmap.

title: Microsoft presents: Accelerate your SMB Business.
description: Deep dive into Microsoft Channel Strategy. News and updates from recent programs and incentives

title: Microsoft presents: AI Billing
description: Session on consumption billing model and tooling for agents and copilot capabilities in Dynamics 365 Business Central.

title: Microsoft presents: Automating Administration with APIs, Logic Apps, and MCP
description: In this session, we'll explore how to automate and streamline administration tasks using the latest tools and endpoints available in the Microsoft ecosystem. Learn how to leverage the tenant discovery endpoint to simplify tenant management across tenants, deploy a Logic App to orchestrate admin workflows, and see a preview of the new Administration MCP Server.

title: Microsoft Presents: Behind the scenes of Copilot features in Business Central
description: Join members of the Business Central team for an exploration how Copilot features are internally being build, tested and released â€¦ as well as what makes them secure, compliant and performant.

title: Microsoft presents: Build Agents for Business Central: Partner Journeys & Insights
description: Join this session and partner panel and hear firsthand from four innovative partners who have integrated AI into their Business Central solutionsâ€”spanning both vertical and horizontal solutions. These partners were part of Microsoft's Red Carpet initiative, designed to support and accelerate the development of their first Business Central Agent based on the Agent platform and tooling in preview

title: Microsoft presents: Build Scalable SMB Solutions with Power Platform & Business Central
description: In this hands-on session, we'll build scalable, impactful solutions for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) using the Power Platform and Dynamics 365 Business Central. Starting from app development, we'll walk through how to automate business processes, integrate with Business Central, and implement lightweight application lifecycle management (ALM) practices including continuous integration, automated testing, and monitoring. Whether you're looking to streamline purchase approvals, enhance inventory visibility, or deliver tailored customer experiences, this session will equip you with practical tools and strategies to accelerate SMB success. Designed with the needs of partners in mind, we'll focus on low-code development, rapid deployment, and real-world scenarios that drive value for SMB customers.

title: Microsoft presents: Building agents for Business Central
description: Join this session to learn about the upcoming Business Central Agent Builder Playground, and how you can use this to start prototyping and troubleshooting your own agents.

title: Microsoft presents: Building agents in Copilot Studio using Model Context Protocol
description: In this session, we will explore how to create intelligent agents within Copilot Studio using the powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP). Attendees will learn how to leverage open standards and advanced frameworks to build scalable, efficient agents capable of dynamic interactions and real-time adaptation. We'll walk through the integration of multiple tools, strategies for enhancing agent functionality, and how these principles contribute to the future of interoperable AI systems. Whether you're a beginner or seasoned developer, this session will provide key insights into enhancing the agent development lifecycle.

title: Microsoft presents: Close More Deals with Microsoft Product Marketing
description: You have the executive sponsorship, sales talent, and track record to help you sell Business Central, but do you have the targeted content and insights that your customer needs to close the deal? Join Tom Paquin, Product marketing lead for Business Central to discuss the resources, tools, and triggers that delvier high impact solution content engineered for your audience right when you need it. This session will cover level 100 material, ABM, down-funnel content, and competitive intelligence. Join this session to deepen your relationship with Microsoft product marketing and to better arm your whole team with the tools for success.

title: Microsoft presents: Cloud for Sovereignty and Business Central
description: This session will cover the Cloud for Sovereignty features available in Dynamics 365 Business Central.

title: Microsoft presents: Competitive Discovery and Why We Win
description: Do you want the latest strategies and insights on how to compete strategically in competitive Dynamics 365 Business Central opportunities? Join Microsoft in a deep, info-packed session that explores the details, tactics, and strategies needed to displace and engage in direct competition with Business Central opportunities. Join this session to review the state of the market, the major players and newcomers, and how to exercise Microsoft's right to win in every engagement.

title: Microsoft Presents: Data-Driven Copilot Experiences in Business Central: Summarize
description: Discover how Copilot in Business Central is transforming the way people work with data. With the new Summarize capability, users can quickly understand complex information and instantly see what's most important or urgent. In this session, we'll explore how the feature works, the opportunities it creates for customers, and a look behind the scenes. You'll also get a preview of how Summarize can be used with custom extensionsâ€”and what's coming next on the roadmap.

title: Microsoft presents: Design patterns
description: Join us for this session where we will explore the design patterns. We will cover the changes to requesting events. We will also cover event and extensibility design patterns and lastly modernizing the AL development by using the design patterns from other languages.

title: Microsoft presents: Explore the opportunity for Business Applications in the Nonprofit industry
description: In this session we will be presenting the opportunity for partners for growing their business with focus on one of the fastest growing industries in the world. The opportunity in the Nonprofit sector for business applications is tremendous across Low Code, Sales and Business Central

title: Microsoft presents: Extending Chat with your app's documentation
description: Want to reduce support calls, help users onboard faster, and eliminate those repeat questions? Copilot in Business Central allows users to self-serve and learn new skills by asking for explanations, or using the Ask Copilot button to learn about any field. And its all powered through your online documentation! In this session for AppSource app publishers: - Learn how to extend Copilot and connect to your online content - See a few examples in action - Learn best practices and how to verify that your content is Copilot-ready

title: Microsoft presents: Future of localizations and delocalization project
description: Join us for an in-depth look at our latest progress and upcoming roadmap for geo-expansion, including our approach to localization and delocalization. We'll share strategic plans for both Microsoft-led and partner-driven localization efforts and provide an overview of our partner localization pilot program. You'll also get insights into the delivery of new global features shaped by your feedback and ideas. A key focus will be our delocalization strategyâ€”transitioning Microsoft localizations into the W1 base app.

title: Microsoft presents: Getting started with DevOps using AL-Go for GitHub
description: If you are looking to get started with DevOps for your AppSource apps or PTE's, Microsoft provides a free managed DevOps solution called AL-Go for GitHub. This session provides an introduction and overview to AL-Go for GitHub and will walk you through the required steps to get started.

title: Microsoft Presents: Help, my DB is too large! Offloading Data with the External File Storage module
description: In the 2025 Wave 1 release, a curious new module quietly joined the developer toolbox: External File Storage and its connectors. With little documentation and no obvious impact, it left many wondering - what is it, and what can we use it for? This session lifts the veil on the mystery. We'll explore how this module can help you offload large BLOBs from your Business Central database to external storage, freeing up valuable megabytes. You'll learn how it works, how to use it, and what Microsoft envisions for its future. If your database is bursting at the seams, this is your chance to learn how leverage this new tool in the toolbox to slim it down.

title: Microsoft presents: Introducing MCP server for Business Central
description: The MCP server for Business Central is coming in public preview in Fall 2025. Join this session to learn more about MCP, learnings from the early access preview, how it works with MCP clients such as Copilot Studio, and how the roadmap looks for MCP and Business Central.

title: Microsoft presents: Key Business Central partner resources you don't want to miss
description: Join this session full of tips and tricks on how you get your way around resources from Microsoft - whether it's training, readiness, presales, or marketing resources, we got you!

title: Microsoft presents: Make Your Business Central Demos and Presentations Impactful
description: Presentations and software demonstrations are essential in most complex sales, yet they may fall short of audience expectations. When we effectively showcase our solution, we demonstrate our understanding of the audience's needs, leaving a lasting impression. Fundamental skills can sometimes be overshadowed by a focus on technology and solutions. However, if we can't tell a compelling story and reduce friction, our efforts may be in vain. This session is designed for anyone in a customer-facing role (either presales or sales) responsible for delivering impactful presentations. In this session, you will learn how to craft a compelling message that resonates with your audience, make your software look intuitive and user-friendly, and build engaging demo scenes that highlight key features you uncovered during discovery. We will also explore techniques to connect with your audience on a deeper level, ensuring your demonstrations are not only informative but also memorable.

title: Microsoft presents: Make Your Business Central Demos and Presentations Impactful ( Repeat)
description: Presentations and software demonstrations are essential in most complex sales, yet they may fall short of audience expectations. When we effectively showcase our solution, we demonstrate our understanding of the audience's needs, leaving a lasting impression. Fundamental skills can sometimes be overshadowed by a focus on technology and solutions. However, if we can't tell a compelling story and reduce friction, our efforts may be in vain. This session is designed for anyone in a customer-facing role (either presales or sales) responsible for delivering impactful presentations. In this session, you will learn how to craft a compelling message that resonates with your audience, make your software look intuitive and user-friendly, and build engaging demo scenes that highlight key features you uncovered during discovery. We will also explore techniques to connect with your audience on a deeper level, ensuring your demonstrations are not only informative but also memorable.

title: Microsoft presents: Managing large scale DevOps with AL-Go for GitHub
description: Are you managing a lot of repositories and are struggling with controlling conformity, build speed and staying on top of the status of all your repositories? This session will demo how AL-Go for GitHub can help you manage a large number of repositories through telemetry, custom templates and more.

title: Microsoft Presents: Mastering Excel Integration in Business Central
description: Discover how to make the most of the â€œEdit in Excelâ€ feature in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Centralâ€”without diving too deep into the code. This session is designed for consultants who support users, guide implementations, or want to better understand how Excel connects with Business Central. We'll walk through how data flows from Business Central to Excel, how filters and datasets behave, and how to troubleshoot common issues with the Excel add-in. You'll also learn how to extend pages, verify web services, and perform updates directly from Excelâ€”no developer skills required. Plus, we'll showcase how Excel Copilot can help users update data with AI assistance and push changes back to Business Central.

title: Microsoft presents: Mastering the Autofill with Copilot feature
description: Demos and more! Everything you need to know about this exciting Copilot feature visible on pages in Business Central: Autofill. We'll discuss and learn together how it works and what's new, talk about opportunities it unlocks and show a bit behind the scenes. There will be also a chance to see how the feature can be extended and what's coming on the roadmap.

title: Microsoft presents: On-prem to cloud migrations
Microsoft presents: Partner incentives, benefits and winning formulas!
description: Come to this session to get an overview of - and insight into - specific partner benefits provided by Microsoft in FY26. This session will also cover other learnings based on experience navigating the Microsoft GTM space

title: Microsoft presents: Payables Agent - the product manager perspective to building agents
description: Get a non-technical insight into development of the Payables Agent. Learn how a Microsoft product manager gets from idea to development of an agent, how we prototype with AI, and how we design for human-in-the-loop and how we visualize the process and imagine agent capabilities in the realm of Accounts Payables. You'll get inspired to build agents and Copilot features, as well as get a glimpse of building product at Microsoft.

title: Microsoft presents: Payables Agent demo and roadmap
description: The Payables Agent modernizes the invoice processing process in accounts payables. Join this session if you want to learn all about the current state of the Payables Agent and how to position the agent to your customers. We will also share our current thoughts on the future and enrichments of the Payables Agent.

title: Microsoft presents: Payables Agent roundtable
description: This is where we want to get your feedback on the Payables Agent and the roadmap. No prerequisites needed. Come and ask questions and discuss the agent, current state, dreams and desires for the future, and let's discuss openly and candidly. We want to learn from you and at the same time explain our thoughts on where the agent is going.

title: Microsoft Presents: Practical Success with Business Central Concierge
description: Join the Business Central Concierge team and partners for an behind-the-scenes look at how they're driving impact together with Business central Concierge. This session goes beyond theoryâ€”delivering practical insights and actionable takeaways to help you succeed in larger, more complex customer implementations. Whether you're scaling your business or navigating enterprise-level deployments, this is your chance to learn directly from those who've done it.

title: Microsoft presents: Pricing and licensing
description: This session goes in detail with a variety of topics and updates surrounding Business Central licensing. Including Business Central online licensing, Legacy Dynamics Pricelist licensing, migration offers - and all up good to know insights into commercial topics like the New Commerce System(NCE), attached licensing, M365 and more. If you have already attended a Business Central licensing session in the past - many of the insights will be familiar as parts of the session will be a repeat

title: Microsoft presents: Productivity with Business Central user interface - both desktop and mobile
description: Are you a consultant working with Business Central? Join this session delivered by the Business Central engineering team to learn about various usability and productivity improvements added to the product in the last releases and discuss what could be planned for the future. This session is packed with productivity tips and dives into the most significant customer-facing enhancements in last releases.

title: Microsoft presents: Profiling First - How to Diagnose Performance Issues
description: Performance issues in Business Central application code can be frustrating, but diagnosing them doesn't have to be. In this session, we'll show why *background profiling* should be your first step when troubleshooting performance problems reported by customers. Microsoft has made significant improvements to the profiler in the new release, making it easier to pinpoint bottlenecks and understand execution flow. You'll learn how to use the profiler across different contexts: UI, web services, job queues, and other background sessions. We'll also explore complementary tools that help complete the picture. If you are a partner supporting customer solutions, the tools and techniques presented in this session are invaluable for diagnosing issues quickly and effectively.

title: Microsoft presents: Reimagining ERP - How to Demo Business Central as an AI-First Solution
description: Are all of your customers asking about Copilot, but you're unsure how to deliver a compelling live demo? Here's 20 tips to master demonstrating agents and Copilot in Business Central with 2025 release wave 2, including: - Setting up your environment - Touring Copilot and agent features - Prompt tips and tricks from the trenches - Key messages to land, phrases and slides you should use - Followup material you can share

title: Microsoft presents: Rethinking the Partner Led Localization strategy.
description: In this session, we'll introduce a new initiative running across select CEE countries aimed at improving the quality and affordability of partner-built Localization Apps. You'll get an inside look at the program's approach, hear why some partners chose to co-create this model, and learn how it addresses key challenges in today's localization landscape

title: Microsoft presents: Securing Business Central | Customer-Driven Best Practices and Real-World Cases
description: In today's fast moving digital landscape, securing your business applications is a strategic imperative. This session dives into Business Central security, presenting customer-driven cases that reveal how organizations have successfully navigated common hurdles with robust security configurations. You'll gain insights from real-world experiences addressing recurring questions around access control, data protection, and compliance. We'll explore actionable best practicesâ€”from implementing role-specific permissions to configuring advanced authentication measuresâ€”that empower you to safeguard your Business Central environment effectively.

title: Microsoft presents: Shopify and Business Central
description: With our latest release, we've added even more capabilities to the Shopify Connector, support more advanced scenarios for Shopify B2B platform, easier troubleshooting, more control over product infomation management, dealing with market catalogues and pricing. The session will also give an update on the combined Business Central and Shopify opportunity.

title: Microsoft presents: Testing AI for safety and quality in Business Central
description: Great AI is not just built, it is tested. In this session, the Business Central team will walk you through the complete testing lifecycle for Copilot and agents, from dataset definition to automated pipeline checks. Learn how to apply data-driven testing to validate your Copilot and agent features, use the AI Test Tool in Business Central, design datasets that improve quality, and run safety evaluations with Azure AI Foundry. We will also share ideas for how testing could be automated and integrated into your development workflow, helping ensure every release meets your safety and quality standards.

title: Microsoft presents: Think You Know Business Central? Prove It in Our In-Product Escape Room
description: Option 1 for Developers: Are you a proficient Business Central Developer? Put your skills to the test in this hands-on escape room challengeâ€”designed by MVPs as part of the BCTalent program and now accessible to all Directions EMEA participants. This immersive experience will push your knowledge in a fun, fast-paced environment! Just bring your laptopâ€”we'll take care of the rest. Oh, and yesâ€¦ there will be prizes.

title: Microsoft presents: Think You Know Business Central? Prove It in Our In-Product Escape Room
description: Option 2 for Consultants: Are you a proficient Business Central Consultant? Put your skills to the test in this hands-on escape room challengeâ€”designed by MVPs as part of the BCTalent program and now accessible to all Directions EMEA participants. This immersive experience will push your knowledge in a fun, fast-paced environment! Just bring your laptopâ€”we'll take care of the rest. Oh, and yesâ€¦ there will be prizes.

title: Microsoft presents: Using Dynamics 365 product together: Business Central and Field Service
description: Curious about how to bring together Business Central and Field Service for a more connected business experience? Join us for a practical session that walks you through how to set up and use these two powerful products side by side. We'll cover licensing and technical prerequisites, share best practices and common pitfalls, and highlight the latest features that make integration easier than ever. You'll also get a sneak peek at what's coming next on the roadmap. Whether you're a consultant, partner, or Business Central user looking to expand into service scenarios, this session will give you the clarity and confidence to get started.

title: Microsoft presents: Web Client performance improvements and how you can make it even faster
description: Learn about latest performance improvements in Business Central Web Client. And what you can do to make it even faster for your customers.

title: Microsoft presents: What is new in governance & administration
description: This session will cover a high-level overview as well as what's new in governance and administration.

title: Microsoft presents: What's new in E-Documents
description: Join us to discover the latest enhancements in E-Documents, including expanded default integrations with global service providers and support for the increasingly adopted e-invoicing clearance model (CTC). We'll introduce handling with new file formats (PDF/A), new document types such as e-shipments and e-transfer shipments, showcase Copilot-powered improvements for document matching, and walk through the new draft page for e-invoices and the two-step processing flow. You'll also hear about new localizations, our roadmap, and much more.

title: Microsoft presents: What's New in Sales Order Agent for Business Central
description: Thanks to customer feedback and research, the Sales Order Agent in Business Central has grown significantly since its last showcase. In this session, we'll walk through new capabilities like support for email attachments, improved search, advanced availability checks with capable-to-promise, natural language instructions to guide the agent, and support for shipping addresses. The agent is now more capable, responsive, and helpful than ever, with much more to show. Come see the improvements firsthand.

title: Microsoft presents: What's new in AL Language and Developer Tools
description: Join us for a forward-looking session, where we explore the latest enhancements in the AL Language and developer tools for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. We'll walk through some of the new capabilities that improve productivity, streamline development workflows, and enhance code quality â€”and a sneak peek at what's brewing for future releases. Whether you're a seasoned AL developer, consultant or just getting started, this session will equip you with insights and tips to make the most of the evolving Business Central development experience.

title: Microsoft presents: What's new in analytics
description: Built-in analytics in Business Central got a huge lift in the 2025 release wave 2 across several function areas. In finance, we enhanced financial reporting, improved the Power BI app, and updated documentation for reports. In sales, we modernized reports and improved the Power BI app. In manufacturing, we modernized reports and improved the Power BI app. And we also improved the data analysis feature. Join this session to get a little taste of everything.

title: Microsoft Presents: What's new in Chat with Copilot
description: Discover how Chat with Copilot in Business Central is evolving to deliver smarter, more contextual chat experiences. In this session, we'll showcase new capabilities like its ability to analyze lists, answer more complex questions about your data, and integration to your ISV documentation â€”empowering users to get answers about your extensions directly in a chat. We'll also explore latest technology updates (MCP) and share how you can bring your own skills into the Copilot experience.

title: Microsoft presents: What's new in document reporting
description: Join us for an overview of the latest enhancements in document reporting from 2025 release wave 1 and 2. Focus will be on features from wave 2. We will discuss Word layouts, PDF features, and more. We will also disclose ideas for the future of document reporting in Business Central.

title: Microsoft presents: What's new in Finance
description: Join us for an overview of the latest enhancements in financial management. We'll cover improvements in subscription billing but also see the new Accounts Payable (A/P) role center, the Excise Taxes framework, some FA automations, and other key updates aimed at streamlining financial operations. We will also explain some upcoming features for the next release.

title: Microsoft presents: What's new in financial reporting
description: Join us for an overview of the latest enhancements in the financial reporting feature from 2025 release wave 1 and 2. Focus will be on features from wave 2. We will discuss topics such as Excel layouts, PDF output formats, sample reports, scheduling of reports, and how you can run a report across all values of a dimension.

title: Microsoft presents: What's new in manufacturing
description: In the 2025 release wave 1, we released updates manufacturing in two areas: new feature enhancements and analytics. Join this session to learn how to manage product information, block output, use attachments, undo or revert various production operations, order rescheduling, integration to warehouse. You will also learn new updates for analytics, including the updated Power BI app as well as many new reports.

title: Microsoft presents: What's new in server and database
description: Join us for an overview of the latest enhancements in the Business Central server and corresponding database from 2025 release wave 1 and 2. Focus will be on features from wave 2.

title: Microsoft presents: What's new in Sustainability
description: Join us to explore the latest innovations in the Business Central sustainability module. We'll walk through our progress to date and unveil powerful new featuresâ€”ranging from regulatory compliance to brand-driven sustainability initiatives. This session will spotlight key enhancements, including the new Copilot for Sustainability, Power BI reports, and regulatory tools such as CSRD integration, CBAM, and EPR calculations. We'll also showcase how you can now track your Scope 3 carbon footprint across your entire value chain and display emissions data directly on sales documents. Whether you're focused on compliance, transparency, or environmental impact, this session will equip you with the tools and insights to drive meaningful changeâ€”powered by your feedback and ideas.

title: Microsoft presents: What's new in Test automation
description: Join us in this session to learn about the latest improvements in the test automation. As the software industry evolves, we are witnessing faster updates, shorter release cycles and AI being used to generate code. With these changes, it is important to invest more in the test automation to enable us to deliver the solutions at the faster pace while maintaining high quality. During this session we will cover main topics of: Mock web service calls for testing the integrations Using resources in tests Data driven testing Code coverage - identify which tests cover each method New test categorization Test libraries in SaaS

title: Microsoft presents: What's new in VSC and AL
description: Join this session for an overview of the lastest improvements in the Business Central developer experience. We will cover features such as GitHub Copilot, performance profiler, page scripting, testing and much more

title: Microsoft presents: Workshop - Extending Chat with your app's documentation
description: Want to reduce support calls, help users onboard faster, and eliminate those repeat questions based on your documentation? Copilot in Business Central allows users to self-serve and learn new skills by asking for explanations, or using the Ask Copilot button to learn about any field. In this workshop ISV developers: - Hands on experience how to extend Copilot and connect to your online content - Learn best practices and how to verify that your content is Copilot-ready

title: Microsoft roundtable: AL-Go for GitHub
description: Meet with the team owning AL-Go for GitHub and share your thoughts on the challenges you are facing and what you'd like to see us invest in.

title: Microsoft roundtable: Auditing challenges
description: When an external or internal auditor needs to do a financial or IT audit of a Business Central environment, there are things that are easy and things that are tedious. In this roundtable, we will quickly present a plan for making these tasks easier. And then shift to feedback mode to hear your ideas and feedback.

title: Microsoft roundtable: EDI in Business Central - The Future or a Footnote?
description: With the latest enhancements to the E-Documents architecture, we've unlocked new possibilitiesâ€”extending far beyond e-invoicing. From supporting additional document formats to enabling broader automation scenarios, the groundwork is in place. But what about EDI? In this open discussion, we want to hear from you: Should EDI become a native part of Business Central? What formats and flows would matter mostâ€”EDIFACT, PEPPOL, something else? And if you're skeptical, we want to understand why. There's no decision yetâ€”just an honest conversation about what's possible, what's needed, and what's next, and there are no prerequisites needed.

title: Microsoft roundtable: 'Project Gotland' Agent
description: Join us for a roundtable discussion on the upcoming release of Microsoft's new agent - 'Project Gotland' Agent. This marks a significant step forward in our journey toward building AI/Model-driven features as it will lead to specific situation creating complete Agent-cetric modules. We'll explore what does it mean for the future and how it opens new possibilities for innovation.

title: Microsoft roundtable: Shopify Connector
description: Microsoft continues investments into Shopify Connector and planning a next round of improvements. Remember to register your product suggestion at the aka.ms/BCIdeas in advance and let's work together on prioritization or additional input for scenarios.

title: Microsoft Western Europe Presents: FY26 Strategy, GTM & Best Practices
description: *Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Finland, Ireland, Italy, Norway, Portugal, Spain, Sweden Join us to hear more about the core growth opportunity in Western Europe. In this regional session, we focus on sharing the Microsoft view on business performance, growth opportunities and market insights. This session will also cover programs and help available that is applicable to the Poland market. Join to meet the leaders from Microsoft and get ready for accelerated growth in FY26!

title: Microsoft workshop: Developing and testing Copilot in Business Central
description: Curious about what it takes to build interactive Copilot experiences in Business Central? Then join this workshop and learn how to use the developer tools for Copilot in Business Central to build your features. The workshop will cover the Prompt Dialog and Prompt Action UX pieces, calling the LLM, testing with the AI test tool, and handle consumption based billing with Business Central AI resources. This will be a self-paced workshop where you can follow written instructions and/or a video, with subject matter experts available for help and questions.

title: Microsoft workshop: Extend E-Documents with new Interface
description: Join us for a hands-on technical workshop where we'll explore the newly redesigned E-Documents interfaceâ€”built to go far beyond traditional e-invoicing. Discover how to elevate your E-Documents experience to support a wide variety of business scenarios, including the exchange of diverse electronic file types. We'll dive into some of the latest capabilities such as the clearance model, shipment document handling, and moreâ€”showing you how to extend these features in real time. This is a fully interactive technical sessionâ€”not a presentation. Please come prepared with your laptop with BC Docker and VS Code pre-installed, and be ready for 105 minutes of active work.

title: More than a demo: leaving subtle traps for the competitors
description: We are not naÃ¯ve, right? Every time we come for a demo, we know we are not the only ones the customer is talking to. But how often you do you proactively address this? Do you have a strategy to overcome the competition and maybe even leave some subtle traps for your competitors? If you are not, chances are your competitors will set them up for you. Join the session to learn how you can outsmart your competition by leaving subtle traps while demoing the solution: â€¢ Addressing the competition: The recommended and proven ways â€¢ Demoing with the purpose: Leaving subtle traps â€¢ Anticipating counter-moves: Preparing for competitor responses We do not demo solutions to feel good about ourselves. We demo solutions to win the deal! Learn yet more tips to do it.

title: NAVIPARTNER I Empower your retail journey with Shopify and world-class POS
description: Join our session to discover the full potential of our cloud-based POS solution and how our solutions have successfully centralized all retail operations into a single, comprehensive platform. We'll showcase how we have harmonized physical and online sales, inventory, and finance, providing complete visibility and control over your supply chain and data. We'll take you through the end-to-end process with our NP Retail solution, covering everything from product sales via your webshop or in-store transactions to seamless integration between these two channels. You'll explore how our POS solution integrates with Shopify, the loyalty program, and the payment process through our NP Pay solution. Furthermore, we aim to demonstrate how our mPOS solution streamlines ordering and inventory management, allowing you to quickly replenish out-of-stock products directly on the shop floor.

title: Negotiation Advantage: Collaboration in a Tech-Driven World
description: We all work with people. Increasingly, we also work with AI. Whether you are writing code, consulting prospects, leading teams, or supporting customers, your day involves constant negotiation. Not just the formal kind, but the everyday-type too: aligning goals, handling internal misunderstandings, prioritizing work, managing expectations...and also, deciding how and when to trust AI. In this session, we will explore: â€¢ Why negotiation isn't just another skill- it is how we work together and succeed; â€¢ What changes (and what doesn't) when AI joins the team; â€¢ How to negotiate and collaborate better.

title: Next-Level Page Scripting with BC and Copilot: Hands-on examples and script post-processing
description: Explore how the Page Scripting tool can streamline testing for Business Central projects. Dive deep into practical examples illustrating different scripting scenarios and learn how to leverage Microsoft 365 Copilot to convert scripts into traditional test scenarios as a supplement for UATs. Hear the latest from Microsoft's roadmap on planned enhancements for the Page Scripting tool - empowering both consultants and power users to work faster, document better and test more.

title: No-Code Mobile Apps & AI-powered EDI & E-Invoice with Anvaigo
description: Anvaigo is your partner for mobile app solutions, EDI, and E-Invoice. Anvaigo Mobile App: You think PowerApps is easy? Then get to know Anvaigo - because this new version is revolutionary: experience a 10-minute installation including customizations, awesome functionality, and faster deployments! We offer powerful turnkey solutions: for sales, field service, deliveries, checklists, and an easy-to-use app builder for individual requirements. Anvaigo EDI Connect: Let us show you the easiest AI-powered EDI solution available: 100% Dynamics + No-Code! Anvaigo is a flexible data interchange platform for any type of EDI and E-Invoice tasks to significantly reduce your go-live and support time.

title: Not a Developer? No Problem! Workshop: Deploy & Embed Power BI Apps in Business Central
description: Want to embed your Power BI reports into Business Central, but you're not a developer? No problemâ€”this workshop is for you! Whether you're using the new out-of-the-box Power BI app or creating your own custom reports, we'll walk you through everything you need to know. You'll learn how to deploy and set up Power BI Apps within your Business Central environment and then how to embed them directly into Business Central. The goal? To help your customers access rich, insightful reporting without ever leaving Business Central. This session is designed for non-developersâ€”we'll take it step-by-step so anyone can follow along and build the skills needed to take advantage of this powerful integration. With so many exciting new features in Power BI and Business Central, now's the time to learn how to make reporting easier, more accessible, and more impactful. Don't miss this opportunity to impress your customers and elevate their everyday reporting experience!

title: OAuth revealed
description: OAuth remains a mystery for many people. It has many secrets (pun intended). But we can't avoid it anymore, so we should get used to it. In this session, we will explore OAuth thoroughly. You will gain insights into how it works, the differences between public and confidential clients, what various authorization flows mean, and much more!

title: Onboarding Consultants for Impact: How a Vertical Reseller Speeds Up Success with Business Central
description: Onboarding is often rushed or inconsistentâ€”whether it's for new hires or new customers. But done right, it can be a powerful way to reduce risk, build trust, and deliver value faster. In this session, we'll show how one Business Central reseller created a structured, repeatable onboarding model that works for both people and projects. Using Microsoft 365 tools, industry-specific workflows, and in-house e-learning, we've built a scalable approach that improves delivery, confidence, and satisfaction from day one. You'll learn: Why better onboarding improves ROI and reduces delays How to build repeatable onboarding for employees and clients How to use Microsoft 365 (Teams, SharePoint, etc.) to automate the process How vertical â€œhappy pathsâ€ help speed up time-to-value A simple framework and real examples you can apply in your business This session is ideal for partner leads, operations teams, and people managers looking to improve delivery and engagement.

title: One platform - endless possibilities
description: What if we told you that integration projects could be simpler? Your customers are tired of solutions complicating things when they should be making things easier. They need a solution that can keep up with their changing needs and deliver the good stuff - real results, fast. Discover the platform built on one truth - Integration Made Smpl. - where any integration combination works in perfect harmony. Pick one solution, several, or choose all. It's up to you. One intelligent platform. Endless ways to give your customers the edge they need. Because when integration 'just works', businesses thrive. Start smpl. join our session!

title: Optimizing Microsoft 365 Copilot Agents with Copilot Studio and Power Platform Analytics
description: Optimizing multi-agent systems built with Microsoft Copilot Studio poses a significant challenge: most user interactions - simple Q&A exchanges - lack structured feedback suitable for traditional analytics. Are users clarifying their tasks? Questioning model quality? Reporting confusion? Without answers, it's hard to decide whether to retrain models, educate users, or redesign the agent architecture. In this session, we present a practical framework that uses LLM-based classification to characterize user intent. Each incoming user message is automatically labeled by type (clarification, feedback, additional info, etc.), forming a structured event log for analysis. We'll walk through: - Using Microsoft Copilot Studio to enrich agent telemetry and route structured data to Application Insights - Applying LLM pipelines to tag conversation intents - Leveraging Power Automate Process Mining to detect interaction bottlenecks and user friction points - Making actionable decisions: from training material improvements to architecture redesign This is a highly practical, demo-driven session for: - Power Platform developers building AI-powered solutions - Architects designing conversational interfaces - System analysts optimizing Copilot usage in enterprise environments Join us to discover how structured data and process insights can turn black-box agent behavior into measurable, improvable systems.

title: Partner 2 Partner: Unlocking Growth with Ingram Micro
description: Welcome to the Future of Partnering in the Microsoft Ecosystem Discover how Ingram Micro connects you with over 1,400 MSPs to create powerful Partner-to-Partner (P2P) opportunities. Learn the keys to successful collaboration, avoid common errors, and turn partnerships into leads. Whether expanding into Dynamics 365 or launching a new practice, Ingram's programs, resources, and expert support help you scale faster. Dive into BizApps Connect - a complete ecosystem offering training, co-selling, marketing, and early access to innovations like Microsoft Copilot Chat. More than a program, it's your launchpad for success in the Microsoft ecosystem. Join us and unlock your full potential through strategic partnering and digital transformation.

title: Partner's Guide to Securing your Customer Portal in Power Pages
description: Giving Customer, Vendors, and Partners access to your Power Pages Portal can be one of the most challenging parts of building a portal. In this session you'll learn a proven repeatable invitation process that ensures seamless access to your portal. You'll learn: -How to provide a secure access to Business Central Customers -How to choose and setup Authorization and Authentication methods -Understand the difference between invitations and registrations -How to secure you pages and tables from designated users. Whether you're building a customer portal or planning to scale your access strategy, this session will help you open the door without losing control of the keys.

title: Planning under Pressure across Procurement, Production and Sales with BC and orderbase PlanningBoard
description: In this session, we explore how Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central and the orderbase PlanningBoard can be combined to enable realistic, capacity-constrained production planning. While Business Central offers robust ERP functionality, it assumes unlimited capacity â€” a limitation that the PlanningBoard effectively addresses. We will highlight key planning challenges such as limited material availability, delayed procurement, and production bottlenecks, and demonstrate how the PlanningBoard supports better coordination across purchasing, production, and sales. Real-world use cases will show how delivery dates can be validated more reliably, how disruptions in the supply chain are managed, and how realistic scheduling leads to more transparency and control. This session is ideal for production planners, operations managers, and IT professionals looking to enhance their planning capabilities beyond standard ERP features.

title: Play it (w)right: automate your end-to-end tests in the Power Platform
description: Everyone knows software testing is crucial, even in low-code setups! Testing is often seen as the necessary evil, time-consuming work. It can be done differently: automate your tests in the Power Platform! The goal isn't to slow down production but to make sure everything meets standards and reduces risks. So I'll take you into the world of automated testing in the Power Platform. This session is fully packed with live demos. I will share tips on how to use and extend the Power Apps Live monitor to test and monitor your apps. We will take a look at the Power Apps Test Studio and dive deep into automated end-to-end testing using Playwright. By the end of the session, you will have learned about the differences between Power Apps Test Studio and Playwright and have a practical understanding of how to implement Playwright into your workflow, making your testing not only more efficient but also more robust.

title: POWER 2GO Solutions
description: POWER 2GO Solutions are fixed-price products based on Microsoft Power Apps technology. Consists of three different product applications for effectively managing the sales, service and project processes. POWER 2GO Solutions are compact solutions with a fully parameterizable, clear scope delivered in a few days at a fixed price with no risk based on Power Apps without the necessity of any customisation or development during the implementation. SALES 2GO: Manages the whole sales deal process, which can be separated into different stages based on a configurable Sales Deal Parameter table (i.e.: Prospect, Sales Deal, Quote). Different sales processes can be defined without any customisation or development. SERVICE 2GO: Ideal for field technicians to organise service and customer support processes in a compact and simple way. Provides the possibility to manage knowledge base articles and customer assets with a parameterizable worksheet and service task management. PROJECT 2GO: Project lifecycles can be parameterised. Different types of resources can be allocated to the projects, so you know exactly who has what tasks and when. Relationships between project tasks can be used to define different dependencies. Available integration capabilities for: M365, Business Central, Power BI and to custom applications. Ideal for end customers and ISV partners, SMB partners since we offer auto-release DevOps-based pipeline management, updates, new features.

title: Powerful Report Automation for Business Central and beyond
description: Explore intuitive report automation for Business Central in our session: Simplify complex document design using dynamic elements like tables, charts & images in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Integrate data from Business Central, SharePoint, M365 & more. Collaborate effortlessly by managing templates and text blocks within M365 & SharePoint. Archive and distribute documents seamlessly into M365, SharePoint or ECM archives. Empower your team with efficient emailing and digital signature capabilities. Join us to unlock the potential of report automation and see how the partnership with dox42 will revolutionize generating documents!

title: Practical MCP for AL developers
description: So the customer wants a MCP server with Business Central data and business logic, what do you do? Come to this session and discover your options.

title: Ready to transform your Dynamics BC business into an AI-first powerhouse?
description: Join Will McIntee, Gemma McAllany and Clarinda Dobbelaar for an inspiring and hands-on session for Dynamics business leaders who are ready to embrace the future. In this presentation, we will explore how to define your AI strategy, mapping out your transformation journey, and show how Companial can support you in every step. Will McIntee, a veteran of channel transformation, one of the founders of Companial, will walk you through the journey towards what should be a successful and profitable AI-First business. We call this journey â€˜the Road to AI'. Taking this road, is going to be an adventure: it's about rethinking a new business model and way of doing business. Most importantly, as with every journey, you need to decide if you are going to take the first step. How this works in practice, you will hear from Gemma McAllany, CPO at Xperience. She will share her experience in building real-world AI use casesâ€”from identifying the opportunity to supporting clients with sustainable and secure AI adoption. Xperience has taken the first steps and is delivering Co-Pilot, Agents and Business Central solutions to its customers. Gemma will share how she has worked with her clients, bringing the AI+BC story to life. Clarinda Dobbelaar, VP Marketing, will share a practical model for identifying AI opportunities and how to work with your clients towards a new business model. She will share tips to get you going on the spot. Don't miss this chance to turn vision into action!

title: Real-World Messaging with Azure: Patterns That Power Your Integrations
description: Whether you connect Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central to AI services, banking platforms, third-party apps, or legacy systems, messaging patterns remain the backbone of reliable, scalable integrations. But with Azure offering a toolbox full of messaging services, Service Bus, Event Grid, Event Hubs, and more, it's easy to get lost in the options. In this session, Tharanga Chandrasekara and Steve Gichure will bring clarity by walking you through real-world use cases that apply proven messaging patterns to practical integration challenges. You'll learn how to: - Seamlessly connect Business Central to modern and legacy systems - Leverage patterns for resilience, scalability, and message durability - Use Azure messaging components the right way at the right time - Build integrations that talk to anything from AI engines to banking systems This isn't just theory, it's code, demos, and real-world experience you can take back to your customers. This session is for you if you're ready to go beyond the basics and bring messaging patterns to life.

title: Reporting in Word/Excel can be easy, because it is easy.
description: We have heard it a lot - in RDLC, it was possible, but in Word/Excel, we cannot do this. Or maybe the truth is different. We can do this, and we will do this together. This workshop is for consultants and developers who want to create complicated layouts for their clients. We will use real-life examples that seem to be impossible to implement without the RDLC report layout. Together, we will discover some hidden gems in this methodology. This workshop is not about new functionalities. It is not about new possibilities. It is about what is already there, but for some reason, it was hidden from us. Or we just simply were missing such possibilities.

With built-in AI functionality, your customers gain a powerful assistant that works alongside their teams to optimize decision-making, solve specific challenges, and deliver real results, all while freeing up time to focus on what matters most. Join inventory specialist Ben Chapman to discover how Netstock helps your customers: Create accurate, data-driven orders with confidence. Prevent stock-outs with proactive alerts and intelligent forecasting. Reduce excess inventory and improve cash flow. Turn complex inventory data into clear, actionable insights using built-in AI tools. This session is for you if you want to help your customers eliminate their inventory struggles and boost efficiency.

title: Solving real-world manufacturing challenges with Business Central
description: Are your Business Central customers struggling with a lack of real- time data capture from the shop floor?
