It moves partners beyond one-off integrations to a unified data and integration platform that enables scale, resilience, and innovation. By building strategy into delivery, partners can safeguard revenue, lock in customer loyalty, and turn every project into a foundation for future growth. In this session, you will learn how to: - Identify the hidden risks of operating without a data integration strategy - Use eOne iPaaS+ to deliver scalable and insight-driven customer experiences - Transform integration work into repeatable, margin-positive growth - Protect against churn by embedding data strategy into customer success

title: Stop over-engineering permissions: use exclude to secure faster and smarter

In this high-impact session, you'll discover how to radically simplify permission setup using exclude. We'll show you how to build lean, secure, and fully functional authorizations in 1 or 2 days, instead of weeks. Even better: you'll learn how to solve internal control and compliance challenges with minimal effort. This session is perfect for anyone who wants to combine speed, simplicity, and security â€” and stop wasting time reinventing the permission wheel. Key takeaways: - How to identify the exact permission sets you need (and skip the rest) - How to leverage exclude to streamline setup and reduce risk - How to solve internal control & compliance issues, without overcomplicating your setup

description: Your customers aren't shopping for a chatbot - they're investing in outcomes that drive revenue, efficiency, and competitive edge. You'll learn how to: - Reframe your value proposition using real AI use cases. - Position AI effectively in your sales cycleâ€”from first conversation to final proposal. - Differentiate your brand with industry-specific stories that inspire confidence and urgency. - Address executive concerns about risk, adoption, and ROI with clear, credible messaging. Together, we'll look at examples of compelling AI storytelling, practice simple frameworks to develop your own narratives

title: Super fast tests covering 100% of your code

The talk is based on the development of an App for AppSource and has lead to a series of articles on my blog. https://www.finnpedersenfrance.com/programming/2025/06/26/environment-interface-part-1.html https://www.finnpedersenfrance.com/programming/2025/06/26/environment-interface-part-2.html https://www.finnpedersenfrance.com/programming/2025/06/26/environment-interface-part-3.html https://www.finnpedersenfrance.com/programming/2025/06/26/temporary-tables-in-tests.html Code examples on GitHub https://github.com/finnpedersenfrance/BC-Environment-Interfaces

Learn how to work with this data in practice. Explore use cases of a Digital Product Passport and what you need to be aware of when preparing for ESG reporting. The takeaway is clear. Product data is moving from being nice-to-have to being the key for compliance, market access, and competitiveness. Partners who understand this shift can guide their customers with confidence.

No fluff. Just the truth about where we're headedâ€”and how to get ahead of it.

title: Vibe coding. The hottest new programming language is English
description: How prompting AI has made English your new favorite programming language. You get an idea in the morning and you put it in production in the afternoon. This session will discuss how to - write a good GitHub Issue. - brainstorm with Copilot Workspace - let Copilot review your code Understanding this can help users, consultants, project managers and developers better communicate on bugs, features and extensions.

title: Vibe Coding: What I Learned Letting AI Write My Code (And Why You Should Care)
description: What happens when you stop writing code and start managing an AI that writes it for you? Over the past few months, I've conducted an experiment: letting AI agents handle most of my software development work while I focused on directing, reviewing, and fixing what they produced. The results were eye-opening: both thrilling and terrifying. In this 45-minute session, I'll share the unfiltered reality of "vibe coding" with AI agents, including: - The productivity paradise: How AI can outmatch your output 10x on greenfield projects when everything goes right. - The maintenance nightmare: Why "machines can read any code" doesn't mean they can maintain any code. - The dangerous comfort zone: How prompting instead of coding creates a slippery slope toward irrelevance. - The knowledge trap: Why understanding the output becomes more critical than ever, and what happens when you don't. Whether you're a developer, functional consultant, or technical decision-maker, this session will help you navigate the rapidly evolving landscape where AI is becoming your programming partner, competitor, and replacement (probably in that same order).

title: Vibe-Driven Development: Why Your Best Developers Will Hate This (And Why It Works Anyway)
description: When clients call with "we need something that tracks X by next week," most developers cringe. But what if that ambiguity could become your competitive advantage? Partners who rapidly translate business problems into working solutions win more deals and keep clients happier. Most senior developers hate this idea. No spec? No backlog grooming? But we already work this way - vague requests, half-baked ideas, last-minute "can-you-just" tasks are real life. Vibe-Driven Development embraces that reality, showing how AI turns ambiguity into competitive advantage. We'll take a loosely defined business need and use GitHub Copilot to shape it into a full Business Central solution, from design and development through documentation, testing, and delivery. You'll learn how to: â€¢ Break down fuzzy requests using AI prompts â€¢ Use AI for architecture and naming decisions â€¢ Generate AL scaffolding, test codeunits, and release notes â€¢ Identify critical review points where human expertise must override AI, particularly around Business Central's posting frameworks, permission design, and integration patterns This isn't about replacing your expertise, it's about accelerating delivery when you're handed a problem and a deadline. Whether skeptical or curious, you'll leave with a new perspective on how AI supports the way you already work while maintaining quality standards.

Co-hosted by Rick McCutcheon, a 12-time Microsoft Business Applications MVP, and Jason Gumpert, Editor of MSDynamicsWorld, the session will provide key data-backed takeaways and encourage an interactive conversation on how partners can adapt and thrive in a changing landscape. Whether you are leading a marketing transformation, exploring new key performance indicators (KPIs), or seeking to understand future customer expectations, this session will equip you with practical insights and foresight. Key Survey Findings (20 mins) â€¢ Future buyer behavior â€¢ Evolving content trends â€¢ Role of AI in marketing and sales â€¢ Strategic KPIs and success metrics Fireside Chat with Jason Gumpert (15 mins) â€¢ Partner implications â€¢ Surprising insights â€¢ Open dialogue on actionable strategies Interactive Audience Discussion (15-20 mins) â€¢ Open floor for partner input and predictions Key Takeaways â€¢ An exclusive look at industry sentiment and trends from your peers â€¢ Actionable ideas for evolving sales and marketing strategies â€¢ Opportunities to shape future discussions within the Business Applications ecosystem

title: Webhook to Business Central: Integration with Azure Logic Apps and Service Bus
description: In today's connected world, webhooks offer a powerful way to deliver real-time data between systems. But integrating them into Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central presents unique architectural and reliability challenges. In this session, we'll explore how to design a robust, event-driven integration using Azure Logic Apps and Azure Service Bus. You'll learn when to use direct Logic App calls versus decoupled messaging patterns, how to ensure delivery and resiliency with Service Bus, and best practices for securing and monitoring incoming webhook traffic. Ideal for developers and architects building scalable, automated integrations with Business Central.

title: What is GitOps and why should you care?
description: Hopefully, you are no longer managing your Azure infrastructure manually through the Azure Portal, aka "ClickOps". Infrastructure as Code approaches like Bicep or Terraform have seen a lot of uptake in the last couple of years and certainly are a big step forwards. But what if we could take that approach to the next level by managing your resources directly in a Git repository and letting a tool handle the rollout and maintenance? That is the idea of GitOps! In this session, you will learn about the basics of using GitOps with Azure and see in hands-on demos how it actually works

title: When Dynamics 365 Sales Meets Business Central: Making the Most of Your BC and Sales Integration
description: Business Central and Sales are different worlds, and even the best integrations often reflect these limitations. In this session, we will dive into real scenarios where Dynamics 365 Business Central and Sales integration face data synchronization challenges. We will explore practical solutions to overcome common issues, such as pricing inconsistencies, shipping complexities, etc. With a focus on real use cases, you'll gain insights into how to tackle limitations coming from the differing purposes of these two powerful platforms. Join us for an in-depth session and discussion on integration and maximizing the value of both systems.

title: Who's Watching the Consultants? Securing Business Central with Microsoft PIM
description: Consultants often have elevated access to multiple customer environments, which makes them high-value targets for attackers. In today's threat landscape, attackers don't break in, but rather log in using stolen credentials, phishing, or token theft to impersonate trusted users. This session will teach partners how to use Microsoft's Privileged Identity Management (PIM) to reduce the risk of identity-based attacks. They'll learn how to implement just-in-time access, approval workflows, and access reviews for Security Groups, which can be used to protect Business Central environments. We'll also explore why phishing-resistant authentication methods like Windows Hello for Business and passkeys are critical for protecting privileged roles. By the end of this session, they'll understand: * Why standing access, even for trusted consultants, is a security risk * How attackers exploit identity-based weaknesses to gain access * How to configure and operationalize PIM for Business Central with Security Groups * How to communicate the value of PIM to stakeholders and customers

title: Why waste time with Gen Z? (Spoiler: You Should!)

We'll explore how generational diversity can drive innovation, challenge outdated norms, and reshape leadership expectations. From the eyes of Gen Z: whether you're a project manager, team lead, or simply curious about the future of work, this session brings practical insights and fresh perspectives on how investing in Gen Z means investing in your company's future.

title: You need to implement Agents now! ...But what even is an Agent?

Because we have a new buzzword in town - Agents! Before we all rush in to implement them, let's stop for a moment and talk about what even is an agent. How do they compare to Copilot Features? How do they actually work? Will we just be managing a fleet of agents in the future? Or should we perhaps still invest in core functionality?
